jacques-n commented on issue #4186: ARROW-5199:[Java] Add unsafe access methods to ArrowBuf
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4186#issuecomment-486342930
 
 
   I'd like to propose that we get ARROW-3191 merged first and then change how to do this. I think it probably makes sense to simply implement an UncheckedBuf<R> which can simply be a set of accessors along with a memory address that interacts with the underlying memory via unchecked methods. The generic <R> can hold a reference object (which may be ArrowBuf) but could be anything else, too. Since the address is exposed in ArrowBuf, you can grab that to create an UncheckedBuf. There is no need for these methods to be directly attached to the ArrowBuf class.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

yuruiz commented on issue #4186: ARROW-5199:[Java] Add unsafe access methods to ArrowBuf
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/4186#issuecomment-486498600
 
 
   > I'd like to propose that we get ARROW-3191 merged first and then change how to do this. I think it probably makes sense to simply implement an UncheckedBuf which can simply be a set of accessors along with a memory address that interacts with the underlying memory via unchecked methods. The generic can hold a reference object (which may be ArrowBuf) but could be anything else, too. Since the address is exposed in ArrowBuf, you can grab that to create an UncheckedBuf. There is no need for these methods to be directly attached to the ArrowBuf class.
   
   Sure, it makes sense to merge ARROW-3191 first. I would prefer having explicit unsafe method so that the external caller would be aware that such a method have no boundary check. If we simply providing an UncheckedBuf implementation if could be quite confusing about the semantics of each accessor.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the

users@infra.apache.org

fields.description: Add unsafe access method to ArrowBuf to allow external user access underlying memory without boundary check
fields.summary: [Java] Add unsafe access method to ArrowBuf

comments.body: There is already a facility for turning off memory checks via environment variable or system property
Transitioning issue from Resolved to Closed to based on resolution field value.
